Class Save

extends java.lang.Object
    Saves objects to file

    3.1
    Author:
    Joseph Omar

    • Method Detail

      • save

        public static void save(boolean skip,
                        Player activePlayer,
                        int playerCounter,
                        int movementsLeft,
                        Coordinate temp,
                        PlayerMovement movement)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Saves a game to a file
        Parameters:
        skip - Skip player
        activePlayer - Current player field
        playerCounter - Player counter field
        movementsLeft - Movements left field
        temp - Temp coordinate field
        movement - Current Player Movement instance
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the file could not be written

      • saveGame

        private static void saveGame(java.util.HashMap<Save.Key,java.lang.Object> data)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Saves the gameboard and it's tiles, the players and their current hands, positions and active effects and the silk bag.
        Parameters:
        data - Objects to be saved to a file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the file cannot be written

      • load

        public static java.util.HashMap<Save.Key,java.lang.Object> load(java.io.File filename)
                                                         throws java.io.IOException,
                                                                java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                                                java.lang.NullPointerException
        Reads the specified Save file and returns a hashmap of the objects contained within
        Parameters:
        filename - The file name to load from
        Returns:
        Hashmap of objects in the file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the file cannot be found
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - If the classes for the objects in the file are not present in the application
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the file does not exist
